intro: Plantago coronopus var. firma, commonly known as the firm common plantain, is a variant of the common plantain, characterized by its robust growth and dense foliage. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along riverbanks, ditches, and in meadows. This variant is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
